title: Thomas Jefferson’s Chess Pie
ingredients: ¼ cup butter, softened to room temperature
1 cup firmly packed light brown sugar
instructions: Using a hand held beater start to cream the butter before adding the sugar and salt; then cream thoroughly.  Add the eggs one at a time and continue beating “thoroughly” after each addition.  After all the eggs have been worked in thoroughly stir in the vanilla, flour, cream, and the pecans; using either the blender set on its lowest setting but preferably using a whisk.
Paint the pastry shell with the Apricot Glaze and pour in the filling.

Bake in the center rack of the preheated oven for 40 to 50 minutes; or, until a knife inserted halfway between the pie crust edge and the center of the pie comes out clean.  It’s important not to over bake the pie.
Source:  The Pies Have It, by Rita Leinwand, Bon Appétit, September 1977.
